channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Amazon extends ban on police use of its facial recognition software
item.description: Reuters reports that 'until further notice' Amazon will continue to bar police departments from using its Rekognition platform

item.title: Google wants to make shopping easier in Photos and Chrome
item.description: In Photos, Google is making it easier to search screenshots for products.

item.title: Google is helping developers build Android apps for bigger screens
item.description: As usual, Google followed up its big I/O keynote with a quicker session focused specifically on the new tools it'll offer the developer community in the coming months. The entire developer keynote is up on YouTube, but here are a handful of things that caught our eyes.

item.title: Google Cast updates make it easier to move audio between devices
item.description: In addition to Android and Wear OS news, Google is introducing new Cast Connect, Stream Transfer and Stream Expansion tools.

item.title: Google is simplifying how developers build Android for Cars apps
item.description: There’s a simpler way to make apps work on both Android Auto and Android Automotive.

item.title: Everything Google announced at I/O 2021
item.description: Here's everything Google announced at I/O 2021.

item.title: Google plans to build a commercial quantum computer by 2029
item.description: The company has a new quantum AI campus in Santa Barbara.

item.title: President Biden reveals Ford's electric F-150 a day early in factory speech
item.description: The US President delivered remarks with the F-150 Lightning creepin' over his shoulder.

item.title: Google’s Project Starline is a ‘magic window’ for 3D telepresence
item.description: Google's Project Starline uses a combination of specialized hardware and computer vision technology to create a “magic window” for immersive video chat without a headset.

item.title: Google's latest AI tool claims to identify common skin conditions
item.description: Google previewed a new AI-powered tool that helps anyone with a smartphone get more information about skin, hair and nail conditions.

item.title: Google is building a more racially inclusive Android camera
item.description: Today at Google I/O, Android VP Sameer Samat revealed that Google is also working to make its Android camera more inclusive, with support for a variety of darker skin tones and different types of hair.

item.title: Google explains how it will run on completely carbon-free energy by 2030
item.description: CEO Sundar Pichai called the ambitious goal a 'moonshot.'

item.title: Google Photos gives users more control over AI-powered Memories
item.description: Pattern recognition, cinematic imagery and organization features will hit the app this year.

item.title: The first Android 12 public beta is available today, here's what's new
item.description: After three developer previews, the first Android 12 public beta is available to download today.

item.title: Google Maps improvements benefit pedestrians and drivers alike
item.description: The billion-plus people who use Google Maps every month will see a marked improvement of the navigation apps performance.

item.title: Android 12 is getting a digital car key feature
item.description: Last year, Apple announced CarKey, a way to unlock your car with your iPhone. Today, Google is following suit — the company just announced that Android 12 will include digital car key technology that lets you lock, unlock and start your car.

item.title: Google and Samsung joined forces on the new Wear OS
item.description: The new Wear OS is the product of Google working with Samsung and Fitbit. Also, goodbye to Tizen OS.

item.title: Google finally turns Android phones into TV remote controls
item.description: Google is bringing built-in remote control tools to Android phones, something that Apple's TVs and iPhones have offered for years.

item.title: Material You is a colorful, personalized redesign for Android and more
item.description: Google just started talking about Android 12 at the Google I/O developer event, and Matias Duarte just introduced a new way to personalize its products called Material You (a riff on Material Design, which Duarte introduced for Android back in 2014).

item.title: Microsoft kills Windows 10X, will bring some features into Windows 10
item.description: Microsoft today confirmed that 10X, its slimmed-down version of Windows 10 for dual-screen devices, won't be released this year after all.

item.title: Google's LaMDA AI can have a 'natural' conversation while pretending to be Pluto
item.description: Google previewed LaMDA(“Language Model for Dialogue Applications”), research it says represents a “breakthrough conversation technology.”

item.title: Google will let you delete the last 15 minutes of your search history
item.description: Android 12 is in line for some useful privacy upgrades.

item.title: Google Chrome now helps you change compromised passwords
item.description: Google Chrome now has a feature that guide you through the process of changing compromised passwords across the web.

item.title: Google's smart canvas is its next big idea for collaborating at work
item.description: Now, Google is taking its workplace productivity apps a step further by introducing smart canvas, a new feature that makes apps like Drive and Sheets smarter and more flexible.

item.title: Spotify will soon automatically transcribe podcasts
item.description: You'll be able to tap on a section to continue listening from that point.
